2729 CSR_WRITE_4(sc, ALC_MISC3, reg);
2730 reg = CSR_READ_4(sc, ALC_MISC);
2731 reg &= ~MISC_INTNLOSC_OPEN;
2732 if (AR816X_REV(sc->alc_rev) <= AR816X_REV_A1)
2733 reg &= ~MISC_ISO_ENB;
2734 CSR_WRITE_4(sc, ALC_MISC, reg);
2735 DELAY(20);
2736 }
2737 if ((sc->alc_flags & ALC_FLAG_AR816X_FAMILY) != 0 ||
2738 sc->alc_ident->deviceid == PCI_PRODUCT_ATTANSIC_AR8152_B ||
2739 sc->alc_ident->deviceid == PCI_PRODUCT_ATTANSIC_AR8151_V2)
2740 CSR_WRITE_4(sc, ALC_SERDES_LOCK,
2741 CSR_READ_4(sc, ALC_SERDES_LOCK) | SERDES_MAC_CLK_SLOWDOWN |
2742 SERDES_PHY_CLK_SLOWDOWN);
2743}
2744
2745static int
2746alc_init(struct ifnet *ifp)
2747{
2748
2749 return alc_init_backend(ifp, true);
2750}
2751
2752static int
2753alc_init_backend(struct ifnet *ifp, bool init)
2754{
2755 struct alc_softc *sc = ifp->if_softc;
2756 struct mii_data *mii;
2757 uint8_t eaddr[ETHER_ADDR_LEN];
2758 bus_addr_t paddr;
2759 uint32_t reg, rxf_hi, rxf_lo;
2760 int error;
2761
2762 /*
2763 * Cancel any pending I/O.
2764 */
2765 alc_stop(ifp, 0);
2766 /*
2767 * Reset the chip to a known state.
2768 */
2769 alc_reset(sc);
2770
2771 /* Initialize Rx descriptors. */
2772 error = alc_init_rx_ring(sc, init);
2773 if (error != 0) {
2774 printf("%s: no memory for Rx buffers.\n", device_xname(sc->sc_dev));
2775 alc_stop(ifp, 0);
2776 return (error);
2777 }
2778 alc_init_rr_ring(sc);
2779 alc_init_tx_ring(sc);
2780 alc_init_cmb(sc);
2781 alc_init_smb(sc);
2782
2783 /* Enable all clocks. */
2784 if ((sc->alc_flags & ALC_FLAG_AR816X_FAMILY) != 0) {
2785 CSR_WRITE_4(sc, ALC_CLK_GATING_CFG, CLK_GATING_DMAW_ENB |
2786 CLK_GATING_DMAR_ENB | CLK_GATING_TXQ_ENB |
2787 CLK_GATING_RXQ_ENB | CLK_GATING_TXMAC_ENB |
2788 CLK_GATING_RXMAC_ENB);
2789 if (AR816X_REV(sc->alc_rev) >= AR816X_REV_B0)
2790 CSR_WRITE_4(sc, ALC_IDLE_DECISN_TIMER,
2791 IDLE_DECISN_TIMER_DEFAULT_1MS);
2792 } else
2793 CSR_WRITE_4(sc, ALC_CLK_GATING_CFG, 0);
2794
2795 /* Reprogram the station address. */
2796 memcpy(eaddr, CLLADDR(ifp->if_sadl), sizeof(eaddr));
2797 CSR_WRITE_4(sc, ALC_PAR0,
2798 eaddr[2] << 24 | eaddr[3] << 16 | eaddr[4] << 8 | eaddr[5]);
2799 CSR_WRITE_4(sc, ALC_PAR1, eaddr[0] << 8 | eaddr[1]);
2800 /*
2801 * Clear WOL status and disable all WOL feature as WOL
2802 * would interfere Rx operation under normal environments.
2803 */
2804 CSR_READ_4(sc, ALC_WOL_CFG);
2805 CSR_WRITE_4(sc, ALC_WOL_CFG, 0);
2806 /* Set Tx descriptor base addresses. */
2807 paddr = sc->alc_rdata.alc_tx_ring_paddr;
2808 CSR_WRITE_4(sc, ALC_TX_BASE_ADDR_HI, ALC_ADDR_HI(paddr));
2809 CSR_WRITE_4(sc, ALC_TDL_HEAD_ADDR_LO, ALC_ADDR_LO(paddr));
2810 /* We don't use high priority ring. */
2811 CSR_WRITE_4(sc, ALC_TDH_HEAD_ADDR_LO, 0);
2812 /* Set Tx descriptor counter. */
2813 CSR_WRITE_4(sc, ALC_TD_RING_CNT,
2814 (ALC_TX_RING_CNT << TD_RING_CNT_SHIFT) & TD_RING_CNT_MASK);
2815 /* Set Rx descriptor base addresses. */
2816 paddr = sc->alc_rdata.alc_rx_ring_paddr;
2817 CSR_WRITE_4(sc, ALC_RX_BASE_ADDR_HI, ALC_ADDR_HI(paddr));
2818 CSR_WRITE_4(sc, ALC_RD0_HEAD_ADDR_LO, ALC_ADDR_LO(paddr));
2819 if ((sc->alc_flags & ALC_FLAG_AR816X_FAMILY) == 0) {
2820 /* We use one Rx ring. */
2821 CSR_WRITE_4(sc, ALC_RD1_HEAD_ADDR_LO, 0);
2822 CSR_WRITE_4(sc, ALC_RD2_HEAD_ADDR_LO, 0);
2823 CSR_WRITE_4(sc, ALC_RD3_HEAD_ADDR_LO, 0);
2824 }
2825 /* Set Rx descriptor counter. */
2826 CSR_WRITE_4(sc, ALC_RD_RING_CNT,
2827 (ALC_RX_RING_CNT << RD_RING_CNT_SHIFT) & RD_RING_CNT_MASK);
2828
2829 /*
2830 * Let hardware split jumbo frames into alc_max_buf_sized chunks.
2831 * if it do not fit the buffer size. Rx return descriptor holds
2832 * a counter that indicates how many fragments were made by the
2833 * hardware. The buffer size should be multiple of 8 bytes.
2834 * Since hardware has limit on the size of buffer size, always
2835 * use the maximum value.
2836 * For strict-alignment architectures make sure to reduce buffer
2837 * size by 8 bytes to make room for alignment fixup.
2838 */
2839 sc->alc_buf_size = RX_BUF_SIZE_MAX;
2840 CSR_WRITE_4(sc, ALC_RX_BUF_SIZE, sc->alc_buf_size);
2841
2842 paddr = sc->alc_rdata.alc_rr_ring_paddr;
2843 /* Set Rx return descriptor base addresses. */
2844 CSR_WRITE_4(sc, ALC_RRD0_HEAD_ADDR_LO, ALC_ADDR_LO(paddr));
2845 if ((sc->alc_flags & ALC_FLAG_AR816X_FAMILY) == 0) {
2846 /* We use one Rx return ring. */
2847 CSR_WRITE_4(sc, ALC_RRD1_HEAD_ADDR_LO, 0);
2848 CSR_WRITE_4(sc, ALC_RRD2_HEAD_ADDR_LO, 0);
2849 CSR_WRITE_4(sc, ALC_RRD3_HEAD_ADDR_LO, 0);
2850 }\
2851 /* Set Rx return descriptor counter. */
2852 CSR_WRITE_4(sc, ALC_RRD_RING_CNT,
2853 (ALC_RR_RING_CNT << RRD_RING_CNT_SHIFT) & RRD_RING_CNT_MASK);
2854 paddr = sc->alc_rdata.alc_cmb_paddr;
2855 CSR_WRITE_4(sc, ALC_CMB_BASE_ADDR_LO, ALC_ADDR_LO(paddr));
2856 paddr = sc->alc_rdata.alc_smb_paddr;
2857 CSR_WRITE_4(sc, ALC_SMB_BASE_ADDR_HI, ALC_ADDR_HI(paddr));
2858 CSR_WRITE_4(sc, ALC_SMB_BASE_ADDR_LO, ALC_ADDR_LO(paddr));
2859
2860 if (sc->alc_ident->deviceid == PCI_PRODUCT_ATTANSIC_AR8152_B) {
2861 /* Reconfigure SRAM - Vendor magic. */
2862 CSR_WRITE_4(sc, ALC_SRAM_RX_FIFO_LEN, 0x000002A0);
2863 CSR_WRITE_4(sc, ALC_SRAM_TX_FIFO_LEN, 0x00000100);
2864 CSR_WRITE_4(sc, ALC_SRAM_RX_FIFO_ADDR, 0x029F0000);
2865 CSR_WRITE_4(sc, ALC_SRAM_RD0_ADDR, 0x02BF02A0);
2866 CSR_WRITE_4(sc, ALC_SRAM_TX_FIFO_ADDR, 0x03BF02C0);
2867 CSR_WRITE_4(sc, ALC_SRAM_TD_ADDR, 0x03DF03C0);
2868 CSR_WRITE_4(sc, ALC_TXF_WATER_MARK, 0x00000000);
2869 CSR_WRITE_4(sc, ALC_RD_DMA_CFG, 0x00000000);
2870 }
2871
2872 /* Tell hardware that we're ready to load DMA blocks. */
2873 CSR_WRITE_4(sc, ALC_DMA_BLOCK, DMA_BLOCK_LOAD);
2874
2875 /* Configure interrupt moderation timer. */
2876 sc->alc_int_rx_mod = ALC_IM_RX_TIMER_DEFAULT;
2877 sc->alc_int_tx_mod = ALC_IM_TX_TIMER_DEFAULT;
2878 reg = ALC_USECS(sc->alc_int_rx_mod) << IM_TIMER_RX_SHIFT;
2879 if ((sc->alc_flags & ALC_FLAG_AR816X_FAMILY) == 0)
2880 reg |= ALC_USECS(sc->alc_int_tx_mod) << IM_TIMER_TX_SHIFT;
2881 CSR_WRITE_4(sc, ALC_IM_TIMER, reg);
2882 /*
2883 * We don't want to automatic interrupt clear as task queue
2884 * for the interrupt should know interrupt status.
2885 */
2886 reg = CSR_READ_4(sc, ALC_MASTER_CFG);
2887 reg &= ~(MASTER_IM_RX_TIMER_ENB | MASTER_IM_TX_TIMER_ENB);
2888 reg |= MASTER_SA_TIMER_ENB;
2889 if (ALC_USECS(sc->alc_int_rx_mod) != 0)
2890 reg |= MASTER_IM_RX_TIMER_ENB;
2891 if ((sc->alc_flags & ALC_FLAG_AR816X_FAMILY) == 0 &&
2892 ALC_USECS(sc->alc_int_tx_mod) != 0)
2893 reg |= MASTER_IM_TX_TIMER_ENB;
2894 CSR_WRITE_4(sc, ALC_MASTER_CFG, reg);
2895 /*
2896 * Disable interrupt re-trigger timer. We don't want automatic
2897 * re-triggering of un-ACKed interrupts.
2898 */
2899 CSR_WRITE_4(sc, ALC_INTR_RETRIG_TIMER, ALC_USECS(0));
2900 /* Configure CMB. */
2901 if ((sc->alc_flags & ALC_FLAG_AR816X_FAMILY) != 0) {
2902 CSR_WRITE_4(sc, ALC_CMB_TD_THRESH, ALC_TX_RING_CNT / 3);
2903 CSR_WRITE_4(sc, ALC_CMB_TX_TIMER,
2904 ALC_USECS(sc->alc_int_tx_mod));
2905 } else {
2906 if ((sc->alc_flags & ALC_FLAG_CMB_BUG) == 0) {
2907 CSR_WRITE_4(sc, ALC_CMB_TD_THRESH, 4);
2908 CSR_WRITE_4(sc, ALC_CMB_TX_TIMER, ALC_USECS(5000));
2909 } else
2910 CSR_WRITE_4(sc, ALC_CMB_TX_TIMER, ALC_USECS(0));
2911 }
2912 /*
2913 * Hardware can be configured to issue SMB interrupt based
2914 * on programmed interval. Since there is a callout that is
2915 * invoked for every hz in driver we use that instead of
2916 * relying on periodic SMB interrupt.
2917 */
2918 CSR_WRITE_4(sc, ALC_SMB_STAT_TIMER, ALC_USECS(0));
2919 /* Clear MAC statistics. */
2920 alc_stats_clear(sc);
2921
2922 /*
2923 * Always use maximum frame size that controller can support.
2924 * Otherwise received frames that has larger frame length
2925 * than alc(4) MTU would be silently dropped in hardware. This
2926 * would make path-MTU discovery hard as sender wouldn't get
2927 * any responses from receiver. alc(4) supports
2928 * multi-fragmented frames on Rx path so it has no issue on
2929 * assembling fragmented frames. Using maximum frame size also
2930 * removes the need to reinitialize hardware when interface
2931 * MTU configuration was changed.
2932 *
2933 * Be conservative in what you do, be liberal in what you
2934 * accept from others - RFC 793.
2935 */
2936 CSR_WRITE_4(sc, ALC_FRAME_SIZE, sc->alc_ident->max_framelen);
2937
2938 if ((sc->alc_flags & ALC_FLAG_AR816X_FAMILY) == 0) {
2939 /* Disable header split(?) */
2940 CSR_WRITE_4(sc, ALC_HDS_CFG, 0);
2941
2942 /* Configure IPG/IFG parameters. */
2943 CSR_WRITE_4(sc, ALC_IPG_IFG_CFG,
2944 ((IPG_IFG_IPGT_DEFAULT << IPG_IFG_IPGT_SHIFT) &
2945 IPG_IFG_IPGT_MASK) |
2946 ((IPG_IFG_MIFG_DEFAULT << IPG_IFG_MIFG_SHIFT) &
2947 IPG_IFG_MIFG_MASK) |
2948 ((IPG_IFG_IPG1_DEFAULT << IPG_IFG_IPG1_SHIFT) &
2949 IPG_IFG_IPG1_MASK) |
2950 ((IPG_IFG_IPG2_DEFAULT << IPG_IFG_IPG2_SHIFT) &
2951 IPG_IFG_IPG2_MASK));
2952 /* Set parameters for half-duplex media. */
2953 CSR_WRITE_4(sc, ALC_HDPX_CFG,
2954 ((HDPX_CFG_LCOL_DEFAULT << HDPX_CFG_LCOL_SHIFT) &
2955 HDPX_CFG_LCOL_MASK) |
2956 ((HDPX_CFG_RETRY_DEFAULT << HDPX_CFG_RETRY_SHIFT) &
2957 HDPX_CFG_RETRY_MASK) | HDPX_CFG_EXC_DEF_EN |
2958 ((HDPX_CFG_ABEBT_DEFAULT << HDPX_CFG_ABEBT_SHIFT) &
2959 HDPX_CFG_ABEBT_MASK) |
2960 ((HDPX_CFG_JAMIPG_DEFAULT << HDPX_CFG_JAMIPG_SHIFT) &
2961 HDPX_CFG_JAMIPG_MASK));
2962 }
2963
2964 /*
2965 * Set TSO/checksum offload threshold. For frames that is
2966 * larger than this threshold, hardware wouldn't do
2967 * TSO/checksum offloading.
2968 */
2969 reg = (sc->alc_ident->max_framelen >> TSO_OFFLOAD_THRESH_UNIT_SHIFT) &
2970 TSO_OFFLOAD_THRESH_MASK;
2971 if ((sc->alc_flags & ALC_FLAG_AR816X_FAMILY) != 0)
2972 reg |= TSO_OFFLOAD_ERRLGPKT_DROP_ENB;
2973 CSR_WRITE_4(sc, ALC_TSO_OFFLOAD_THRESH, reg);
2974 /* Configure TxQ. */
2975 reg = (alc_dma_burst[sc->alc_dma_rd_burst] <<
2976 TXQ_CFG_TX_FIFO_BURST_SHIFT) & TXQ_CFG_TX_FIFO_BURST_MASK;
2977 if (sc->alc_ident->deviceid == PCI_PRODUCT_ATTANSIC_AR8152_B ||
2978 sc->alc_ident->deviceid == PCI_PRODUCT_ATTANSIC_AR8152_B2)
2979 reg >>= 1;
2980 reg |= (TXQ_CFG_TD_BURST_DEFAULT << TXQ_CFG_TD_BURST_SHIFT) &
2981 TXQ_CFG_TD_BURST_MASK;
2982 reg |= TXQ_CFG_IP_OPTION_ENB | TXQ_CFG_8023_ENB;
2983 CSR_WRITE_4(sc, ALC_TXQ_CFG, reg | TXQ_CFG_ENHANCED_MODE);
2984 if ((sc->alc_flags & ALC_FLAG_AR816X_FAMILY) != 0) {
2985 reg = (TXQ_CFG_TD_BURST_DEFAULT << HQTD_CFG_Q1_BURST_SHIFT |
2986 TXQ_CFG_TD_BURST_DEFAULT << HQTD_CFG_Q2_BURST_SHIFT |
2987 TXQ_CFG_TD_BURST_DEFAULT << HQTD_CFG_Q3_BURST_SHIFT |
2988 HQTD_CFG_BURST_ENB);
2989 CSR_WRITE_4(sc, ALC_HQTD_CFG, reg);
2990 reg = WRR_PRI_RESTRICT_NONE;
2991 reg |= (WRR_PRI_DEFAULT << WRR_PRI0_SHIFT |
2992 WRR_PRI_DEFAULT << WRR_PRI1_SHIFT |
2993 WRR_PRI_DEFAULT << WRR_PRI2_SHIFT |
2994 WRR_PRI_DEFAULT << WRR_PRI3_SHIFT);
2995 CSR_WRITE_4(sc, ALC_WRR, reg);
2996 } else {
2997 /* Configure Rx free descriptor pre-fetching. */
2998 CSR_WRITE_4(sc, ALC_RX_RD_FREE_THRESH,
2999 ((RX_RD_FREE_THRESH_HI_DEFAULT <<
3000 RX_RD_FREE_THRESH_HI_SHIFT) & RX_RD_FREE_THRESH_HI_MASK) |
3001 ((RX_RD_FREE_THRESH_LO_DEFAULT <<
3002 RX_RD_FREE_THRESH_LO_SHIFT) & RX_RD_FREE_THRESH_LO_MASK));
3003 }
3004
3005 /*
3006 * Configure flow control parameters.
3007 * XON : 80% of Rx FIFO
3008 * XOFF : 30% of Rx FIFO
3009 */
3010 if ((sc->alc_flags & ALC_FLAG_AR816X_FAMILY) != 0) {
3011 reg = CSR_READ_4(sc, ALC_SRAM_RX_FIFO_LEN);
3012 reg &= SRAM_RX_FIFO_LEN_MASK;
3013 reg *= 8;
3014 if (reg > 8 * 1024)
3015 reg -= RX_FIFO_PAUSE_816X_RSVD;
3016 else
3017 reg -= RX_BUF_SIZE_MAX;
3018 reg /= 8;
3019 CSR_WRITE_4(sc, ALC_RX_FIFO_PAUSE_THRESH,
3020 ((reg << RX_FIFO_PAUSE_THRESH_LO_SHIFT) &
3021 RX_FIFO_PAUSE_THRESH_LO_MASK) |
3022 (((RX_FIFO_PAUSE_816X_RSVD / 8) <<
3023 RX_FIFO_PAUSE_THRESH_HI_SHIFT) &
3024 RX_FIFO_PAUSE_THRESH_HI_MASK));
3025 } else if (sc->alc_ident->deviceid == PCI_PRODUCT_ATTANSIC_AR8131 ||
3026 sc->alc_ident->deviceid == PCI_PRODUCT_ATTANSIC_AR8132) {
3027 reg = CSR_READ_4(sc, ALC_SRAM_RX_FIFO_LEN);
3028 rxf_hi = (reg * 8) / 10;
3029 rxf_lo = (reg * 3) / 10;
3030 CSR_WRITE_4(sc, ALC_RX_FIFO_PAUSE_THRESH,
3031 ((rxf_lo << RX_FIFO_PAUSE_THRESH_LO_SHIFT) &
3032 RX_FIFO_PAUSE_THRESH_LO_MASK) |
3033 ((rxf_hi << RX_FIFO_PAUSE_THRESH_HI_SHIFT) &
3034 RX_FIFO_PAUSE_THRESH_HI_MASK));
3035 }
3036
3037 if ((sc->alc_flags & ALC_FLAG_AR816X_FAMILY) == 0) {
3038 /* Disable RSS until I understand L1C/L2C's RSS logic. */
3039 CSR_WRITE_4(sc, ALC_RSS_IDT_TABLE0, 0);
3040 CSR_WRITE_4(sc, ALC_RSS_CPU, 0);
3041 }
3042
3043 /* Configure RxQ. */
3044 reg = (RXQ_CFG_RD_BURST_DEFAULT << RXQ_CFG_RD_BURST_SHIFT) &
3045 RXQ_CFG_RD_BURST_MASK;
3046 reg |= RXQ_CFG_RSS_MODE_DIS;
3047 if ((sc->alc_flags & ALC_FLAG_AR816X_FAMILY) != 0)
3048 reg |= (RXQ_CFG_816X_IDT_TBL_SIZE_DEFAULT <<
3049 RXQ_CFG_816X_IDT_TBL_SIZE_SHIFT) &
3050 RXQ_CFG_816X_IDT_TBL_SIZE_MASK;
3051 if ((sc->alc_flags & ALC_FLAG_FASTETHER) == 0 &&
3052 sc->alc_ident->deviceid != PCI_PRODUCT_ATTANSIC_AR8151_V2)
3053 reg |= RXQ_CFG_ASPM_THROUGHPUT_LIMIT_1M;
3054 CSR_WRITE_4(sc, ALC_RXQ_CFG, reg);
3055
3056 /* Configure DMA parameters. */
3057 reg = DMA_CFG_OUT_ORDER | DMA_CFG_RD_REQ_PRI;
3058 reg |= sc->alc_rcb;
3059 if ((sc->alc_flags & ALC_FLAG_CMB_BUG) == 0)
3060 reg |= DMA_CFG_CMB_ENB;
3061 if ((sc->alc_flags & ALC_FLAG_SMB_BUG) == 0)
3062 reg |= DMA_CFG_SMB_ENB;
3063 else
3064 reg |= DMA_CFG_SMB_DIS;
3065 reg |= (sc->alc_dma_rd_burst & DMA_CFG_RD_BURST_MASK) <<
3066 DMA_CFG_RD_BURST_SHIFT;
3067 reg |= (sc->alc_dma_wr_burst & DMA_CFG_WR_BURST_MASK) <<
3068 DMA_CFG_WR_BURST_SHIFT;
3069 reg |= (DMA_CFG_RD_DELAY_CNT_DEFAULT << DMA_CFG_RD_DELAY_CNT_SHIFT) &
3070 DMA_CFG_RD_DELAY_CNT_MASK;
3071 reg |= (DMA_CFG_WR_DELAY_CNT_DEFAULT << DMA_CFG_WR_DELAY_CNT_SHIFT) &
3072 DMA_CFG_WR_DELAY_CNT_MASK;
3073 if ((sc->alc_flags & ALC_FLAG_AR816X_FAMILY) != 0) {
3074 switch (AR816X_REV(sc->alc_rev)) {
3075 case AR816X_REV_A0:
3076 case AR816X_REV_A1:
3077 reg |= DMA_CFG_RD_CHNL_SEL_1;
3078 break;
3079 case AR816X_REV_B0:
3080 /* FALLTHROUGH */
3081 default:
3082 reg |= DMA_CFG_RD_CHNL_SEL_3;
3083 break;
3084 }
3085 }
3086 CSR_WRITE_4(sc, ALC_DMA_CFG, reg);
3087
3088 /*
3089 * Configure Tx/Rx MACs.
3090 * - Auto-padding for short frames.
3091 * - Enable CRC generation.
3092 * Actual reconfiguration of MAC for resolved speed/duplex
3093 * is followed after detection of link establishment.
3094 * AR813x/AR815x always does checksum computation regardless
3095 * of MAC_CFG_RXCSUM_ENB bit. Also the controller is known to
3096 * have bug in protocol field in Rx return structure so
3097 * these controllers can't handle fragmented frames. Disable
3098 * Rx checksum offloading until there is a newer controller
3099 * that has sane implementation.
3100 */
3101 reg = MAC_CFG_TX_CRC_ENB | MAC_CFG_TX_AUTO_PAD | MAC_CFG_FULL_DUPLEX |
3102 ((MAC_CFG_PREAMBLE_DEFAULT << MAC_CFG_PREAMBLE_SHIFT) &
3103 MAC_CFG_PREAMBLE_MASK);
3104 if ((sc->alc_flags & ALC_FLAG_AR816X_FAMILY) != 0 ||
3105 sc->alc_ident->deviceid == PCI_PRODUCT_ATTANSIC_AR8151 ||
3106 sc->alc_ident->deviceid == PCI_PRODUCT_ATTANSIC_AR8151_V2 ||
3107 sc->alc_ident->deviceid == PCI_PRODUCT_ATTANSIC_AR8152_B2)
3108 reg |= MAC_CFG_HASH_ALG_CRC32 | MAC_CFG_SPEED_MODE_SW;
3109 if ((sc->alc_flags & ALC_FLAG_FASTETHER) != 0)
3110 reg |= MAC_CFG_SPEED_10_100;
3111 else
3112 reg |= MAC_CFG_SPEED_1000;
3113 CSR_WRITE_4(sc, ALC_MAC_CFG, reg);
3114
3115 /* Set up the receive filter. */
3116 alc_iff(sc);
3117 alc_rxvlan(sc);
3118
3119 /* Acknowledge all pending interrupts and clear it. */
3120 CSR_WRITE_4(sc, ALC_INTR_MASK, ALC_INTRS);
3121 CSR_WRITE_4(sc, ALC_INTR_STATUS, 0xFFFFFFFF);
3122 CSR_WRITE_4(sc, ALC_INTR_STATUS, 0);
3123
3124 sc->alc_flags &= ~ALC_FLAG_LINK;
3125 /* Switch to the current media. */
3126 mii = &sc->sc_miibus;
3127 mii_mediachg(mii);
3128
3129 callout_schedule(&sc->sc_tick_ch, hz);
3130
3131 ifp->if_flags |= IFF_RUNNING;
3132 ifp->if_flags &= ~IFF_OACTIVE;
3133
3134 return (0);
3135}
3136
3137static void
3138alc_stop(struct ifnet *ifp, int disable)
3139{
3140 struct alc_softc *sc = ifp->if_softc;
3141 struct alc_txdesc *txd;
3142 struct alc_rxdesc *rxd;
3143 uint32_t reg;
3144 int i;
3145
3146 callout_stop(&sc->sc_tick_ch);
3147
3148 /*
3149 * Mark the interface down and cancel the watchdog timer.
3150 */
3151 ifp->if_flags &= ~(IFF_RUNNING | IFF_OACTIVE);
3152 ifp->if_timer = 0;
3153
3154 sc->alc_flags &= ~ALC_FLAG_LINK;
3155
3156 alc_stats_update(sc);
3157
3158 mii_down(&sc->sc_miibus);
3159
3160 /* Disable interrupts. */
3161 CSR_WRITE_4(sc, ALC_INTR_MASK, 0);
3162 CSR_WRITE_4(sc, ALC_INTR_STATUS, 0xFFFFFFFF);
3163
3164 /* Disable DMA. */
3165 reg = CSR_READ_4(sc, ALC_DMA_CFG);
3166 reg &= ~(DMA_CFG_CMB_ENB | DMA_CFG_SMB_ENB);
3167 reg |= DMA_CFG_SMB_DIS;
3168 CSR_WRITE_4(sc, ALC_DMA_CFG, reg);
3169 DELAY(1000);
3170
3171 /* Stop Rx/Tx MACs. */
3172 alc_stop_mac(sc);
3173
3174 /* Disable interrupts which might be touched in taskq handler. */
3175 CSR_WRITE_4(sc, ALC_INTR_STATUS, 0xFFFFFFFF);
3176
3177 /* Disable L0s/L1s */
3178 alc_aspm(sc, 0, IFM_UNKNOWN);
3179
3180 /* Reclaim Rx buffers that have been processed. */
3181 if (sc->alc_cdata.alc_rxhead != NULL)
3182 m_freem(sc->alc_cdata.alc_rxhead);
3183 ALC_RXCHAIN_RESET(sc);
3184 /*
3185 * Free Tx/Rx mbufs still in the queues.
3186 */
3187 for (i = 0; i < ALC_RX_RING_CNT; i++) {
3188 rxd = &sc->alc_cdata.alc_rxdesc[i];
3189 if (rxd->rx_m != NULL) {
3190 bus_dmamap_sync(sc->sc_dmat, rxd->rx_dmamap, 0,
3191 rxd->rx_dmamap->dm_mapsize, BUS_DMASYNC_POSTREAD);
3192 bus_dmamap_unload(sc->sc_dmat, rxd->rx_dmamap);
3193 m_freem(rxd->rx_m);
3194 rxd->rx_m = NULL;
3195 }
3196 }
3197 for (i = 0; i < ALC_TX_RING_CNT; i++) {
3198 txd = &sc->alc_cdata.alc_txdesc[i];
3199 if (txd->tx_m != NULL) {
3200 bus_dmamap_sync(sc->sc_dmat, txd->tx_dmamap, 0,
3201 txd->tx_dmamap->dm_mapsize, BUS_DMASYNC_POSTWRITE);
3202 bus_dmamap_unload(sc->sc_dmat, txd->tx_dmamap);
3203 m_freem(txd->tx_m);
3204 txd->tx_m = NULL;
3205 }
3206 }
3207}
3208
3209static void
3210alc_stop_mac(struct alc_softc *sc)
3211{
3212 uint32_t reg;
3213 int i;
3214
3215 alc_stop_queue(sc);
3216 /* Disable Rx/Tx MAC. */
3217 reg = CSR_READ_4(sc, ALC_MAC_CFG);
3218 if ((reg & (MAC_CFG_TX_ENB | MAC_CFG_RX_ENB)) != 0) {
3219 reg &= ~(MAC_CFG_TX_ENB | MAC_CFG_RX_ENB);
3220 CSR_WRITE_4(sc, ALC_MAC_CFG, reg);
3221 }
3222 for (i = ALC_TIMEOUT; i > 0; i--) {
3223 reg = CSR_READ_4(sc, ALC_IDLE_STATUS);
3224 if ((reg & (IDLE_STATUS_RXMAC | IDLE_STATUS_TXMAC)) == 0)
3225 break;
3226 DELAY(10);
3227 }
3228 if (i == 0)
3229 printf("%s: could not disable Rx/Tx MAC(0x%08x)!\n",
3230 device_xname(sc->sc_dev), reg);
3231}
3232
3233static void
3234alc_start_queue(struct alc_softc *sc)
3235{
3236 uint32_t qcfg[] = {
3237 0,
3238 RXQ_CFG_QUEUE0_ENB,
3239 RXQ_CFG_QUEUE0_ENB | RXQ_CFG_QUEUE1_ENB,
3240 RXQ_CFG_QUEUE0_ENB | RXQ_CFG_QUEUE1_ENB | RXQ_CFG_QUEUE2_ENB,
3241 RXQ_CFG_ENB
3242 };
3243 uint32_t cfg;
3244
3245 /* Enable RxQ. */
3246 cfg = CSR_READ_4(sc, ALC_RXQ_CFG);
3247 if ((sc->alc_flags & ALC_FLAG_AR816X_FAMILY) == 0) {
3248 cfg &= ~RXQ_CFG_ENB;
3249 cfg |= qcfg[1];
3250 } else
3251 cfg |= RXQ_CFG_QUEUE0_ENB;
3252 CSR_WRITE_4(sc, ALC_RXQ_CFG, cfg);
3253 /* Enable TxQ. */
3254 cfg = CSR_READ_4(sc, ALC_TXQ_CFG);
3255 cfg |= TXQ_CFG_ENB;
3256 CSR_WRITE_4(sc, ALC_TXQ_CFG, cfg);
3257}
3258
3259static void
3260alc_stop_queue(struct alc_softc *sc)
3261{
3262 uint32_t reg;
3263 int i;
3264
3265 /* Disable RxQ. */
3266 reg = CSR_READ_4(sc, ALC_RXQ_CFG);
3267 if ((sc->alc_flags & ALC_FLAG_AR816X_FAMILY) == 0) {
3268 if ((reg & RXQ_CFG_ENB) != 0) {
3269 reg &= ~RXQ_CFG_ENB;
3270 CSR_WRITE_4(sc, ALC_RXQ_CFG, reg);
3271 }
3272 } else {
3273 if ((reg & RXQ_CFG_QUEUE0_ENB) != 0) {
3274 reg &= ~RXQ_CFG_QUEUE0_ENB;
3275 CSR_WRITE_4(sc, ALC_RXQ_CFG, reg);
3276 }
3277 }
3278 /* Disable TxQ. */
3279 reg = CSR_READ_4(sc, ALC_TXQ_CFG);
3280 if ((reg & TXQ_CFG_ENB) != 0) {
3281 reg &= ~TXQ_CFG_ENB;
3282 CSR_WRITE_4(sc, ALC_TXQ_CFG, reg);
3283 }
3284 DELAY(40);
3285 for (i = ALC_TIMEOUT; i > 0; i--) {
3286 reg = CSR_READ_4(sc, ALC_IDLE_STATUS);
3287 if ((reg & (IDLE_STATUS_RXQ | IDLE_STATUS_TXQ)) == 0)
3288 break;
3289 DELAY(10);
3290 }
3291 if (i == 0)
3292 printf("%s: could not disable RxQ/TxQ (0x%08x)!\n",
3293 device_xname(sc->sc_dev), reg);
3294}
3295
3296static void
3297alc_init_tx_ring(struct alc_softc *sc)
3298{
3299 struct alc_ring_data *rd;
3300 struct alc_txdesc *txd;
3301 int i;
3302
3303 sc->alc_cdata.alc_tx_prod = 0;
3304 sc->alc_cdata.alc_tx_cons = 0;
3305 sc->alc_cdata.alc_tx_cnt = 0;
3306
3307 rd = &sc->alc_rdata;
3308 memset(rd->alc_tx_ring, 0, ALC_TX_RING_SZ);
3309 for (i = 0; i < ALC_TX_RING_CNT; i++) {
3310 txd = &sc->alc_cdata.alc_txdesc[i];
3311 txd->tx_m = NULL;
3312 }
3313
3314 bus_dmamap_sync(sc->sc_dmat, sc->alc_cdata.alc_tx_ring_map, 0,
3315 sc->alc_cdata.alc_tx_ring_map->dm_mapsize, BUS_DMASYNC_PREWRITE);
3316}
3317
3318static int
3319alc_init_rx_ring(struct alc_softc *sc, bool init)
3320{
3321 struct alc_ring_data *rd;
3322 struct alc_rxdesc *rxd;
3323 int i;
3324
3325 sc->alc_cdata.alc_rx_cons = ALC_RX_RING_CNT - 1;
3326 rd = &sc->alc_rdata;
3327 memset(rd->alc_rx_ring, 0, ALC_RX_RING_SZ);
3328 for (i = 0; i < ALC_RX_RING_CNT; i++) {
3329 rxd = &sc->alc_cdata.alc_rxdesc[i];
3330 rxd->rx_m = NULL;
3331 rxd->rx_desc = &rd->alc_rx_ring[i];
3332 if (alc_newbuf(sc, rxd, init) != 0)
3333 return (ENOBUFS);
3334 }
3335
3336 /*
3337 * Since controller does not update Rx descriptors, driver
3338 * does have to read Rx descriptors back so BUS_DMASYNC_PREWRITE
3339 * is enough to ensure coherence.
3340 */
3341 bus_dmamap_sync(sc->sc_dmat, sc->alc_cdata.alc_rx_ring_map, 0,
3342 sc->alc_cdata.alc_rx_ring_map->dm_mapsize, BUS_DMASYNC_PREWRITE);
3343 /* Let controller know availability of new Rx buffers. */
3344 CSR_WRITE_4(sc, ALC_MBOX_RD0_PROD_IDX, sc->alc_cdata.alc_rx_cons);
3345
3346 return (0);
3347}

3354 sc->alc_cdata.alc_rr_cons = 0;

3360 sc->alc_cdata.alc_rr_ring_map->dm_mapsize,
3361 BUS_DMASYNC_PREREAD | BUS_DMASYNC_PREWRITE);
3362}

3388static void
3389alc_rxvlan(struct alc_softc *sc)
3390{
3391 uint32_t reg;
3392
3393 reg = CSR_READ_4(sc, ALC_MAC_CFG);
3394 if (sc->sc_ec.ec_capenable & ETHERCAP_VLAN_HWTAGGING)
3395 reg |= MAC_CFG_VLAN_TAG_STRIP;
3396 else
3397 reg &= ~MAC_CFG_VLAN_TAG_STRIP;
3398 CSR_WRITE_4(sc, ALC_MAC_CFG, reg);
3399}
3400
3401static void
3402alc_iff(struct alc_softc *sc)
3403{
3404 struct ethercom *ec = &sc->sc_ec;
3405 struct ifnet *ifp = &ec->ec_if;
3406 struct ether_multi *enm;
3407 struct ether_multistep step;
3408 uint32_t crc;
3409 uint32_t mchash[2];
3410 uint32_t rxcfg;
3411
3412 rxcfg = CSR_READ_4(sc, ALC_MAC_CFG);
3413 rxcfg &= ~(MAC_CFG_ALLMULTI | MAC_CFG_BCAST | MAC_CFG_PROMISC);
3414 ifp->if_flags &= ~IFF_ALLMULTI;
3415
3416 /*
3417 * Always accept broadcast frames.
3418 */
3419 rxcfg |= MAC_CFG_BCAST;
3420
3421 if (ifp->if_flags & IFF_PROMISC || ec->ec_multicnt > 0) {
3422 ifp->if_flags |= IFF_ALLMULTI;
3423 if (ifp->if_flags & IFF_PROMISC)
3424 rxcfg |= MAC_CFG_PROMISC;
3425 else
3426 rxcfg |= MAC_CFG_ALLMULTI;
3427 mchash[0] = mchash[1] = 0xFFFFFFFF;
3428 } else {
3429 /* Program new filter. */
3430 memset(mchash, 0, sizeof(mchash));
3431
3432 ETHER_LOCK(ec);
3433 ETHER_FIRST_MULTI(step, ec, enm);
3434 while (enm != NULL) {
3435 crc = ether_crc32_be(enm->enm_addrlo, ETHER_ADDR_LEN);
3436 mchash[crc >> 31] |= 1 << ((crc >> 26) & 0x1f);
3437 ETHER_NEXT_MULTI(step, enm);
3438 }
3439 ETHER_UNLOCK(ec);
3440 }
3441
3442 CSR_WRITE_4(sc, ALC_MAR0, mchash[0]);
3443 CSR_WRITE_4(sc, ALC_MAR1, mchash[1]);
3444 CSR_WRITE_4(sc, ALC_MAC_CFG, rxcfg);
3445}

3447MODULE(MODULE_CLASS_DRIVER, if_alc, "pci");

3452
3453static int
3454if_alc_modcmd(modcmd_t cmd, void *opaque)
3455{
3456 int error = 0;
3457
3458 switch (cmd) {
3459 case MODULE_CMD_INIT:
3460#ifdef _MODULE
3461 error = config_init_component(cfdriver_ioconf_if_alc,
3462 cfattach_ioconf_if_alc, cfdata_ioconf_if_alc);
3463#endif
3464 return error;
3465 case MODULE_CMD_FINI:
3466#ifdef _MODULE
3467 error = config_fini_component(cfdriver_ioconf_if_alc,
3468 cfattach_ioconf_if_alc, cfdata_ioconf_if_alc);
3469#endif
3470 return error;
3471 default:
3472 return ENOTTY;
3473 }
